said in response to an interview with journalist Martin Bashir , who questioned his decision to give his son the car. "You don't ask white people what they buy their kids," Diddy continued. And they buy'em Porsches and convertible Bentleys, and it ain't no question. It's really a racist question and put things back in perspective with money and the way that people still look at you. And I'm not saying that consciously he's a racist. But he probably don't even realize that he would not ask Steve Jobs that. He would be like Steve Jobs has that money and that's the gift his kid is supposed to get.
